post.title: AI-powered IDE vulnerable to prompt-injection attacks
post.excerpt: A critical vulnerability known as CurXecute affects the AI-powered Cursor integrated development environment (IDE), allowing attackers to execute remote code with developer privileges through prompt-injection attacks. This security flaw, identified as CVE-2025-54135, poses risks for data theft and ransomware. Attackers could potentially exploit the vulnerability without user interaction, leading to severe consequences for software projects. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ai-powered-cursor-ide-vulnerable-to-prompt-injection-attacks/
